known_words.definition: A collaborative online encyclopedia where users can edit and contribute.
Cascading Style Sheets, used to style HTML elements.
HyperText Markup Language, the standard for structuring web content.
Content created by users rather than website owners.
An online document editor by Google.
A server-side scripting language for web development.
Application Programming Interface, allows communication between software.
Extensible Markup Language, used for data structuring.
Mobile devices like smartphones and tablets.
Services that allow applications to communicate over the internet.
A programming interface for web documents.
A scripting language for interactive web applications.
The World Wide Web, a system of interconnected web pages.
Online groups where users share interests.
A social media platform for short messages (tweets).
Structured Query Language, used for database management.
The German word for 'database.'
JavaScript Object Notation, a lightweight data format.
Digital audio content distributed online.
A storage location for code, often in version control systems.
A photo-sharing website.

known_but_not_used.definition: A JavaScript library that simplifies DOM manipulation and event handling.
Small pieces of data stored on a user's device by websites.
A framework for responsive web design.

unknown_words.definition: Asynchronous JavaScript and XML, used to update parts of a web page without reloading.
A professional networking platform, similar to LinkedIn, popular in German-speaking countries.
'Semantic Web,' a concept where web data is structured to be more understandable for machines.
